original: Johansson, Gustaf Antomus, fängelsedirektör, Vänersborg, f. 8/9/84 i Gbg av AuiguS’t J. o. Kristina Eriksdtr. G. 16 m. Signe Boiin. Barn: Brita f. 17, Inger 19, Gunvor 24. — Stud :ex. v. Gbgs h. Latin 05, stud. v. Gbgsi högsk. o. Lunds univ., fångv rfortbiMn :kurs f. tj :män av h. grad 22. Priv:lär. i Gbg 05-13, vik. lärov:’lär. d Gbg 08, 09, fäng:rär. v. fångv. å Härianda i Gbg, i Härnösand, å Långholmen, i Malmö o. åter i Gbg 11-33, ord. fäng:-dir. v. straffäng. i Linköp. 33-42, i Vänersb. :sed. 42. Ordf. i arb:löshmd i Linköp. 38-40, v. ordf. i Human, förb. i Väniersb. 43i-45, v. ordf. i fören. Sv :e-Finl. i Vänersb. 44-45, sekr. i Ro-tarykl. S’ed. 46. Led. av sitad;sfullm. i Vänersb. 47. Hobbies: biodil., språk-stud.
translated: Johansson, Gustaf Antomus, prison director, Vänersborg, born on September 8, 1884 in Gothenburg to August J. and Kristina Eriksdtr. Married to Signe Boiin in 1916. Children: Brita (born in 1917), Inger (born in 1919), Gunvor (born in 1924). Completed his Bachelor of Arts in Latin in Gothenburg in 1905, studied at Gothenburg University and Lund University. Completed prison officer training for high-ranking officials in 1922. Was a private tutor in Gothenburg from 1905 to 1913, substitute teacher at a school in Gothenburg in 1908 and 1909, prison officer at Härianda prison in Gothenburg, Härnösand, Långholmen, Malmö, and then back in Gothenburg from 1911 to 1933. Was the regular prison director at Linköping prison from 1933 to 1942, and then became the prison director at Vänersborg. Was the chairman of the unemployment agency in Linköping from 1938 to 1940, vice-chairman of Human Federation in Vänersborg from 1943 to 1945, vice-chairman of the Sweden-Finland association in Vänersborg from 1944 to 1945, and secretary of the Rotary Club in Vänersborg from 1946. Was a member of the city council in Vänersborg in 1947. Hobbies included beekeeping and language studies.
